question: Why do we get goosebumps?
eli5_answer: When we get scared or cold, our body makes tiny muscles in our skin tighten up. This makes our hair stand up straight, which looks like goosebumps! It's like when a cat gets scared and its fur poofs up.

question: Why do I get a stomach ache when I eat too much candy?
eli5_answer: When you eat too much candy, your stomach gets upset because it has to work extra hard to digest all the sugar and other stuff in the candy. This can make your tummy feel yucky and give you a stomach ache.

question: Why do some people need surgery?
eli5_answer: Some people need surgery because there are things inside their body that are not working properly and need to be fixed by a doctor using special tools and techniques.

question: Why do we need to eat a balanced diet?
eli5_answer: Eating a balanced diet is like playing with all the different colors in your crayon box! Just like how using all the colors makes your picture pretty, eating a balanced diet helps keep your body healthy and strong. You need different foods like fruits, vegetables, proteins, and grains to give your body all the vitamins and energy it needs to do all the fun things you love to do!

question: Why do we get pimples?
eli5_answer: We get pimples because our skin makes too much oil and gets clogged with dirt and bacteria.

question: What causes high blood pressure?
eli5_answer: High blood pressure is caused by your heart having to work harder to pump blood through your body. This can happen if you eat too much salt, don't exercise enough, or have a family history of high blood pressure.

question: What is a sore throat?
eli5_answer: A sore throat is when your throat hurts and feels scratchy or painful when you swallow. It can happen when you have a cold or when you talk too much.

question: How does the brain control our sense of taste?
eli5_answer: The brain tells our taste buds what flavors we are tasting when we eat different foods.

question: How does the bladder work?
eli5_answer: The bladder is like a balloon inside our body that holds pee. When it gets full, our brain tells us to go to the bathroom and pee it out.

question: What causes motion sickness?
eli5_answer: Motion sickness happens when your brain gets confused by the messages sent from your eyes, inner ear, and body. This confusion can happen when you're in a car, boat, or plane that's moving in a way that your body is not used to. Your brain doesn't understand why you're moving without you doing it yourself, so it makes you feel sick.

question: How does the reproductive system work?
eli5_answer: When a mommy and a daddy love each other very much, they can make a baby together. The daddy has special cells called sperm and the mommy has special cells called eggs. When the sperm and egg come together, they make a baby grow inside the mommy's belly. Then, after about nine months, the baby is ready to be born. And that's how the reproductive system works!

question: How does our body heal when we get a bruise?
eli5_answer: When we get a bruise, our body sends special cells to the area to clean up the mess and make it better. These cells help to remove the blood that leaked out of our blood vessels and make the bruise go away.

question: Why do I need to stay hydrated when I'm sick?
eli5_answer: When you're sick, your body needs more water to help fight off the germs and viruses making you feel bad. Drinking water helps your body stay strong and healthy so you can get better faster.

question: How does the blood carry nutrients?
eli5_answer: Blood is like a special delivery system in our bodies that carries all the nutrients we need to stay healthy. It travels through our body in tiny vessels called blood vessels, kind of like roads for cars. The blood picks up nutrients from the food we eat and delivers them to different parts of our body so they can do their job and keep us strong and happy.

question: What are vitamins and minerals?
eli5_answer: Vitamins and minerals are like little helpers that make sure our bodies stay healthy and strong. They can be found in foods like fruits, vegetables, and dairy products. Vitamins help our bodies work properly and minerals help us grow and stay healthy.

question: How does the bladder store urine?
eli5_answer: The bladder is like a balloon that fills up with pee from our kidneys. When we go to the bathroom, the pee goes out of the bladder through a tube called the urethra.

question: Why do we need to brush our teeth?
eli5_answer: We need to brush our teeth to keep them clean and healthy. Brushing removes food particles and bacteria that can cause cavities and gum disease. It also helps to keep our breath fresh and our smiles bright.

question: Why do we need to drink milk for strong bones?
eli5_answer: Drinking milk makes our bones strong because it has a special stuff called calcium that helps our bones grow big and healthy.

question: Why do we get stretch marks?
eli5_answer: Stretch marks occur when the skin stretches too much in a short amount of time, like when someone grows really fast or gains weight quickly. The skin can't keep up with the stretching, so it gets little marks on it called stretch marks.

question: How does exercise benefit our body?
eli5_answer: Exercise benefits our body by making our muscles and bones stronger, helping us stay fit and healthy, and giving us more energy to do things we enjoy. It also helps our heart stay healthy and can improve our mood and make us feel happy.
